message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CE 

This paper deals with information theoretic tools to prove lower bounds on the communication complexity of secure computation, which is a central primitive of modern cryptography. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also uses data processing inequality and new information inequality, which are related to information theory, making cs.IT (Information Theory) another likely sub-category. The paper also deals with the idea of distribution switching, which is related to distributed systems, making cs.DS (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) a possible sub-category. The paper also deals with communication complexity, which is related to computational complexity, making cs.CC (Computational Complexity) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the amount of randomness required by MPC protocols, which is related to computer engineering, making cs.CE (Computer Engineering) a possible sub-category.
